098import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;

100import org.jfree.chart.block.Size2D;
101import org.jfree.chart.api.VerticalAlignment;

107
108/**
109 * A chart class implemented using the Java 2D APIs.  The current version
110 * supports bar charts, line charts, pie charts and xy plots (including time
111 * series data).
112 * <P>
113 * JFreeChart coordinates several objects to achieve its aim of being able to
114 * draw a chart on a Java 2D graphics device: a list of {@link Title} objects
115 * (which often includes the chart's legend), a {@link Plot} and a
116 * {@link org.jfree.data.general.Dataset} (the plot in turn manages a
117 * domain axis and a range axis).
118 * <P>
119 * You should use a {@link ChartPanel} to display a chart in a GUI.
120 * <P>
121 * The {@link ChartFactory} class contains static methods for creating
122 * 'ready-made' charts.
123 *
124 * @see ChartPanel
125 * @see ChartFactory
126 * @see Title
127 * @see Plot
128 */
129public class JFreeChart implements Drawable, TitleChangeListener,
130        PlotChangeListener, ChartElement, Serializable, Cloneable {
131
132    private transient JFreeChartProduct2 jFreeChartProduct2 = new JFreeChartProduct2();
133
134        private transient JFreeChartProduct jFreeChartProduct = new JFreeChartProduct();
135
136        /** For serialization. */
137    private static final long serialVersionUID = -3470703747817429120L;
138
139    /** The default font for titles. */
140    public static final Font DEFAULT_TITLE_FONT
141            = new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 18);
142
143    /** The default background color. */
144    public static final Paint DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_PAINT
145            = UIManager.getColor("Panel.background");
146
147    /** The default background image. */
148    public static final Image DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE = null;
149
150    /** The default background image alignment. */
151    public static final RectangleAlignment DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE_ALIGNMENT = RectangleAlignment.FILL;
152
153    /** The default background image alpha. */
154    public static final float DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE_ALPHA = 0.5f;
155
156    /**
157     * The key for a rendering hint that can suppress the generation of a 
158     * shadow effect when drawing the chart.  The hint value must be a 
159     * Boolean.
160     */
161    public static final RenderingHints.Key KEY_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_GENERATION
162            = new RenderingHints.Key(0) {
163        @Override
164        public boolean isCompatibleValue(Object val) {
165            return val instanceof Boolean;
166        }
167    };
168    
169    /**
170     * Rendering hints that will be used for chart drawing.  This should never
171     * be {@code null}.
172     */
173    private transient RenderingHints renderingHints;
174
175    /** The chart id (optional, will be used by JFreeSVG export). */
176    private String id;
177    
178    /** A flag that controls whether or not the chart border is drawn. */
179    private boolean borderVisible;
180
181    /** The stroke used to draw the chart border (if visible). */
182    private transient Stroke borderStroke;
183
184    /** The paint used to draw the chart border (if visible). */
185    private transient Paint borderPaint;
186
187    /** The padding between the chart border and the chart drawing area. */
188    private RectangleInsets padding;
189
190    /** The chart title (optional). */
191    private TextTitle title;
192
193    /**
194     * The chart subtitles (zero, one or many).  This field should never be
195     * {@code null}.
196     */
197    private List<Title> subtitles;
198
199    /** Draws the visual representation of the data. */
200    private Plot plot;
201
202    /** Paint used to draw the background of the chart. */
203    private transient Paint backgroundPaint;
204
205    /** An optional background image for the chart. */
206    private transient Image backgroundImage;  // todo: not serialized yet
207
208    /** The alignment for the background image. */
209    private RectangleAlignment backgroundImageAlignment = RectangleAlignment.FILL;
210
211    /** The alpha transparency for the background image. */
212    private float backgroundImageAlpha = 0.5f;
213
214    /**
215     * A flag that can be used to enable/disable notification of chart change
216     * events.
217     */
218    private boolean notify;
219
220    /** 
221     * A flag that controls whether or not rendering hints that identify
222     * chart element should be added during rendering.  This defaults to false
223     * and it should only be enabled if the output target will use the hints.
224     * JFreeSVG is one output target that supports these hints.
225     */
226    private boolean elementHinting;
227    
228    /**
229     * Creates a new chart based on the supplied plot.  The chart will have
230     * a legend added automatically, but no title (although you can easily add
231     * one later).
232     * <br><br>
233     * Note that the  {@link ChartFactory} class contains a range
234     * of static methods that will return ready-made charts, and often this
235     * is a more convenient way to create charts than using this constructor.
236     *
237     * @param plot  the plot ({@code null} not permitted).
238     */
239    public JFreeChart(Plot plot) {
240        this(null, null, plot, true);
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Creates a new chart with the given title and plot.  A default font
245     * ({@link #DEFAULT_TITLE_FONT}) is used for the title, and the chart will
246     * have a legend added automatically.
247     * <br><br>
248     * Note that the {@link ChartFactory} class contains a range
249     * of static methods that will return ready-made charts, and often this
250     * is a more convenient way to create charts than using this constructor.
251     *
252     * @param title  the chart title ({@code null} permitted).
253     * @param plot  the plot ({@code null} not permitted).
254     */
255    public JFreeChart(String title, Plot plot) {
256        this(title, JFreeChart.DEFAULT_TITLE_FONT, plot, true);
257    }
258
259    /**
260     * Creates a new chart with the given title and plot.  The
261     * {@code createLegend} argument specifies whether or not a legend
262     * should be added to the chart.
263     * <br><br>
264     * Note that the  {@link ChartFactory} class contains a range
265     * of static methods that will return ready-made charts, and often this
266     * is a more convenient way to create charts than using this constructor.
267     *
268     * @param title  the chart title ({@code null} permitted).
269     * @param titleFont  the font for displaying the chart title
270     *                   ({@code null} permitted).
271     * @param plot  controller of the visual representation of the data
272     *              ({@code null} not permitted).
273     * @param createLegend  a flag indicating whether or not a legend should
274     *                      be created for the chart.
275     */
276    public JFreeChart(String title, Font titleFont, Plot plot,
277                      boolean createLegend) {
278
279        Args.nullNotPermitted(plot, "plot");
280        this.id = null;
281        plot.setChart(this);
282        
283        // create storage for listeners...
284        jFreeChartProduct2.setProgressListeners(new EventListenerList());
285        jFreeChartProduct.setChangeListeners(new EventListenerList());
286        this.notify = true;  // default is to notify listeners when the
287                             // chart changes
288
289        this.renderingHints = new RenderingHints(
290                RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING,
291                RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
292        // added the following hint because of 
293        // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7785082/
294        this.renderingHints.put(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL,
295                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_PURE);
296        
297        this.borderVisible = false;
298        this.borderStroke = new BasicStroke(1.0f);
299        this.borderPaint = Color.BLACK;
300
301        this.padding = RectangleInsets.ZERO_INSETS;
302
303        this.plot = plot;
304        plot.addChangeListener(this);
305
306        this.subtitles = new ArrayList<>();
307
308        // create a legend, if requested...
309        if (createLegend) {
310            LegendTitle legend = new LegendTitle(this.plot);
311            legend.setMargin(new RectangleInsets(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0));
312            legend.setBackgroundPaint(Color.WHITE);
313            legend.setPosition(RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
314            this.subtitles.add(legend);
315            legend.addChangeListener(this);
316        }
317
318        // add the chart title, if one has been specified...
319        if (title != null) {
320            if (titleFont == null) {
321                titleFont = DEFAULT_TITLE_FONT;
322            }
323            this.title = new TextTitle(title, titleFont);
324            this.title.addChangeListener(this);
325        }
326
327        this.backgroundPaint = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_PAINT;
328
329        this.backgroundImage = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE;
330        this.backgroundImageAlignment = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE_ALIGNMENT;
331        this.backgroundImageAlpha = DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_IMAGE_ALPHA;
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Returns the ID for the chart.
336     * 
337     * @return The ID for the chart (possibly {@code null}).
338     */
339    public String getID() {
340        return this.id;
341    }
342    
343    /**
344     * Sets the ID for the chart.
345     * 
346     * @param id  the id ({@code null} permitted).
347     */
348    public void setID(String id) {
349        this.id = id;
350    }
351    
352    /**
353     * Returns the flag that controls whether or not rendering hints 
354     * ({@link ChartHints#KEY_BEGIN_ELEMENT} and 
355     * {@link ChartHints#KEY_END_ELEMENT}) that identify chart elements are 
356     * added during rendering.  The default value is {@code false}.
357     * 
358     * @return A boolean.
359     * 
360     * @see #setElementHinting(boolean) 
361     */
362    public boolean getElementHinting() {
363        return this.elementHinting;
364    }
365    
366    /**
367     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not rendering hints 
368     * ({@link ChartHints#KEY_BEGIN_ELEMENT} and 
369     * {@link ChartHints#KEY_END_ELEMENT}) that identify chart elements are 
370     * added during rendering.
371     * 
372     * @param hinting  the new flag value.
373     * 
374     * @see #getElementHinting() 
375     */
376    public void setElementHinting(boolean hinting) {
377        this.elementHinting = hinting;
378    }
379    
380    /**
381     * Returns the collection of rendering hints for the chart.
382     *
383     * @return The rendering hints for the chart (never {@code null}).
384     *
385     * @see #setRenderingHints(RenderingHints)
386     */
387    public RenderingHints getRenderingHints() {
388        return this.renderingHints;
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Sets the rendering hints for the chart.  These will be added (using the
393     * {@code Graphics2D.addRenderingHints()} method) near the start of the
394     * {@code JFreeChart.draw()} method.
395     *
396     * @param renderingHints  the rendering hints ({@code null} not permitted).
397     *
398     * @see #getRenderingHints()
399     */
400    public void setRenderingHints(RenderingHints renderingHints) {
401        Args.nullNotPermitted(renderingHints, "renderingHints");
402        this.renderingHints = renderingHints;
403        fireChartChanged();
404    }
405
406    /**
407     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not a border is drawn around the
408     * outside of the chart.
409     *
410     * @return A boolean.
411     *
412     * @see #setBorderVisible(boolean)
413     */
414    public boolean isBorderVisible() {
415        return this.borderVisible;
416    }
417
418    /**
419     * Sets a flag that controls whether or not a border is drawn around the
420     * outside of the chart.
421     *
422     * @param visible  the flag.
423     *
424     * @see #isBorderVisible()
425     */
426    public void setBorderVisible(boolean visible) {
427        this.borderVisible = visible;
428        fireChartChanged();
429    }
430
431    /**
432     * Returns the stroke used to draw the chart border (if visible).
433     *
434     * @return The border stroke.
435     *
436     * @see #setBorderStroke(Stroke)
437     */
438    public Stroke getBorderStroke() {
439        return this.borderStroke;
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Sets the stroke used to draw the chart border (if visible).
444     *
445     * @param stroke  the stroke.
446     *
447     * @see #getBorderStroke()
448     */
449    public void setBorderStroke(Stroke stroke) {
450        this.borderStroke = stroke;
451        fireChartChanged();
452    }
453
454    /**
455     * Returns the paint used to draw the chart border (if visible).
456     *
457     * @return The border paint.
458     *
459     * @see #setBorderPaint(Paint)
460     */
461    public Paint getBorderPaint() {
462        return this.borderPaint;
463    }
464
465    /**
466     * Sets the paint used to draw the chart border (if visible).
467     *
468     * @param paint  the paint.
469     *
470     * @see #getBorderPaint()
471     */
472    public void setBorderPaint(Paint paint) {
473        this.borderPaint = paint;
474        fireChartChanged();
475    }
476
477    /**
478     * Returns the padding between the chart border and the chart drawing area.
479     *
480     * @return The padding (never {@code null}).
481     *
482     * @see #setPadding(RectangleInsets)
483     */
484    public RectangleInsets getPadding() {
485        return this.padding;
486    }
487
488    /**
489     * Sets the padding between the chart border and the chart drawing area,
490     * and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
491     *
492     * @param padding  the padding ({@code null} not permitted).
493     *
494     * @see #getPadding()
495     */
496    public void setPadding(RectangleInsets padding) {
497        Args.nullNotPermitted(padding, "padding");
498        this.padding = padding;
499        notifyListeners(new ChartChangeEvent(this));
500    }
501
502    /**
503     * Returns the main chart title.  Very often a chart will have just one
504     * title, so we make this case simple by providing accessor methods for
505     * the main title.  However, multiple titles are supported - see the
506     * {@link #addSubtitle(Title)} method.
507     *
508     * @return The chart title (possibly {@code null}).
509     *
510     * @see #setTitle(TextTitle)
511     */
512    public TextTitle getTitle() {
513        return this.title;
514    }
515
516    /**
517     * Sets the main title for the chart and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent}
518     * to all registered listeners.  If you do not want a title for the
519     * chart, set it to {@code null}.  If you want more than one title on
520     * a chart, use the {@link #addSubtitle(Title)} method.
521     *
522     * @param title  the title ({@code null} permitted).
523     *
524     * @see #getTitle()
525     */
526    public void setTitle(TextTitle title) {
527        if (this.title != null) {
528            this.title.removeChangeListener(this);
529        }
530        this.title = title;
531        if (title != null) {
532            title.addChangeListener(this);
533        }
534        fireChartChanged();
535    }
536
537    /**
538     * Sets the chart title and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all
539     * registered listeners.  This is a convenience method that ends up calling
540     * the {@link #setTitle(TextTitle)} method.  If there is an existing title,
541     * its text is updated, otherwise a new title using the default font is
542     * added to the chart.  If {@code text} is {@code null} the chart
543     * title is set to {@code null}.
544     *
545     * @param text  the title text ({@code null} permitted).
546     *
547     * @see #getTitle()
548     */
549    public void setTitle(String text) {
550        if (text != null) {
551            if (this.title == null) {
552                setTitle(new TextTitle(text, JFreeChart.DEFAULT_TITLE_FONT));
553            } else {
554                this.title.setText(text);
555            }
556        }
557        else {
558            setTitle((TextTitle) null);
559        }
560    }
561
562    /**
563     * Adds a legend to the plot and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all
564     * registered listeners.
565     *
566     * @param legend  the legend ({@code null} not permitted).
567     *
568     * @see #removeLegend()
569     */
570    public void addLegend(LegendTitle legend) {
571        addSubtitle(legend);
572    }
573
574    /**
575     * Returns the legend for the chart, if there is one.  Note that a chart
576     * can have more than one legend - this method returns the first.
577     *
578     * @return The legend (possibly {@code null}).
579     *
580     * @see #getLegend(int)
581     */
582    public LegendTitle getLegend() {
583        return getLegend(0);
584    }
585
586    /**
587     * Returns the nth legend for a chart, or {@code null}.
588     *
589     * @param index  the legend index (zero-based).
590     *
591     * @return The legend (possibly {@code null}).
592     *
593     * @see #addLegend(LegendTitle)
594     */
595    public LegendTitle getLegend(int index) {
596        int seen = 0;
597        for (Title subtitle : this.subtitles) {
598            if (subtitle instanceof LegendTitle) {
599                if (seen == index) {
600                    return (LegendTitle) subtitle;
601                }
602                else {
603                    seen++;
604                }
605            }
606        }
607        return null;
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Removes the first legend in the chart and sends a
612     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
613     *
614     * @see #getLegend()
615     */
616    public void removeLegend() {
617        removeSubtitle(getLegend());
618    }
619
620    /**
621     * Returns a new list containing all the subtitles for the chart.
622     *
623     * @return The subtitle list (possibly empty, but never {@code null}).
624     *
625     * @see #setSubtitles(List)
626     */
627    public List<Title> getSubtitles() {
628        return new ArrayList<>(this.subtitles);
629    }
630
631    /**
632     * Sets the title list for the chart (completely replaces any existing
633     * titles) and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered
634     * listeners.
635     *
636     * @param subtitles  the new list of subtitles ({@code null} not
637     *                   permitted).
638     *
639     * @see #getSubtitles()
640     */
641    public void setSubtitles(List<Title> subtitles) {
642        Args.nullNotPermitted(subtitles, "subtitles");
643        setNotify(false);
644        clearSubtitles();
645        for (Title t: subtitles) {
646            if (t != null) {
647                addSubtitle(t);
648            }
649        }
650        setNotify(true);  // this fires a ChartChangeEvent
651    }
652
653    /**
654     * Returns the number of titles for the chart.
655     *
656     * @return The number of titles for the chart.
657     *
658     * @see #getSubtitles()
659     */
660    public int getSubtitleCount() {
661        return this.subtitles.size();
662    }
663
664    /**
665     * Returns a chart subtitle.
666     *
667     * @param index  the index of the chart subtitle (zero based).
668     *
669     * @return A chart subtitle.
670     *
671     * @see #addSubtitle(Title)
672     */
673    public Title getSubtitle(int index) {
674        if ((index < 0) || (index >= getSubtitleCount())) {
675            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Index out of range.");
676        }
677        return this.subtitles.get(index);
678    }
679
680    /**
681     * Adds a chart subtitle, and notifies registered listeners that the chart
682     * has been modified.
683     *
684     * @param subtitle  the subtitle ({@code null} not permitted).
685     *
686     * @see #getSubtitle(int)
687     */
688    public void addSubtitle(Title subtitle) {
689        Args.nullNotPermitted(subtitle, "subtitle");
690        this.subtitles.add(subtitle);
691        subtitle.addChangeListener(this);
692        fireChartChanged();
693    }
694
695    /**
696     * Adds a subtitle at a particular position in the subtitle list, and sends
697     * a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
698     *
699     * @param index  the index (in the range 0 to {@link #getSubtitleCount()}).
700     * @param subtitle  the subtitle to add ({@code null} not permitted).
701     */
702    public void addSubtitle(int index, Title subtitle) {
703        Args.requireInRange(index, "index", 0, getSubtitleCount());
704        Args.nullNotPermitted(subtitle, "subtitle");
705        this.subtitles.add(index, subtitle);
706        subtitle.addChangeListener(this);
707        fireChartChanged();
708    }
709
710    /**
711     * Clears all subtitles from the chart and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent}
712     * to all registered listeners.
713     *
714     * @see #addSubtitle(Title)
715     */
716    public void clearSubtitles() {
717        for (Title t : this.subtitles) {
718            t.removeChangeListener(this);
719        }
720        this.subtitles.clear();
721        fireChartChanged();
722    }
723
724    /**
725     * Removes the specified subtitle and sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to
726     * all registered listeners.
727     *
728     * @param title  the title.
729     *
730     * @see #addSubtitle(Title)
731     */
732    public void removeSubtitle(Title title) {
733        this.subtitles.remove(title);
734        fireChartChanged();
735    }
736
737    /**
738     * Returns the plot for the chart.  The plot is a class responsible for
739     * coordinating the visual representation of the data, including the axes
740     * (if any).
741     *
742     * @return The plot.
743     */
744    public Plot getPlot() {
745        return this.plot;
746    }
747
748    /**
749     * Returns a flag that indicates whether or not anti-aliasing is used when
750     * the chart is drawn.
751     *
752     * @return The flag.
753     *
754     * @see #setAntiAlias(boolean)
755     */
756    public boolean getAntiAlias() {
757        Object val = this.renderingHints.get(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING);
758        return RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON.equals(val);
759    }
760
761    /**
762     * Sets a flag that indicates whether or not anti-aliasing is used when the
763     * chart is drawn.
764     * <P>
765     * Anti-aliasing usually improves the appearance of charts, but is slower.
766     *
767     * @param flag  the new value of the flag.
768     *
769     * @see #getAntiAlias()
770     */
771    public void setAntiAlias(boolean flag) {
772        Object hint = flag ? RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON 
773                : RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF;
774        this.renderingHints.put(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, hint);
775        fireChartChanged();
776    }
777
778    /**
779     * Returns the current value stored in the rendering hints table for
780     * {@link RenderingHints#KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING}.
781     *
782     * @return The hint value (possibly {@code null}).
783     *
784     * @see #setTextAntiAlias(Object)
785     */
786    public Object getTextAntiAlias() {
787        return this.renderingHints.get(RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING);
788    }
789
790    /**
791     * Sets the value in the rendering hints table for
792     * {@link RenderingHints#KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING} to either
793     * {@link RenderingHints#VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_ON} or
794     * {@link RenderingHints#VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_OFF}, then sends a
795     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
796     *
797     * @param flag  the new value of the flag.
798     *
799     * @see #getTextAntiAlias()
800     * @see #setTextAntiAlias(Object)
801     */
802    public void setTextAntiAlias(boolean flag) {
803        if (flag) {
804            setTextAntiAlias(RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_ON);
805        } else {
806            setTextAntiAlias(RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
807        }
808    }
809
810    /**
811     * Sets the value in the rendering hints table for
812     * {@link RenderingHints#KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING} and sends a
813     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
814     *
815     * @param val  the new value ({@code null} permitted).
816     *
817     * @see #getTextAntiAlias()
818     * @see #setTextAntiAlias(boolean)
819     */
820    public void setTextAntiAlias(Object val) {
821        this.renderingHints.put(RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING, val);
822        notifyListeners(new ChartChangeEvent(this));
823    }
824
825    /**
826     * Returns the paint used for the chart background.
827     *
828     * @return The paint (possibly {@code null}).
829     *
830     * @see #setBackgroundPaint(Paint)
831     */
832    public Paint getBackgroundPaint() {
833        return this.backgroundPaint;
834    }
835
836    /**
837     * Sets the paint used to fill the chart background and sends a
838     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
839     *
840     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} permitted).
841     *
842     * @see #getBackgroundPaint()
843     */
844    public void setBackgroundPaint(Paint paint) {
845        if (this.backgroundPaint != null) {
846            if (!this.backgroundPaint.equals(paint)) {
847                this.backgroundPaint = paint;
848                fireChartChanged();
849            }
850        } else {
851            if (paint != null) {
852                this.backgroundPaint = paint;
853                fireChartChanged();
854            }
855        }
856    }
857
858    /**
859     * Returns the background image for the chart, or {@code null} if
860     * there is no image.
861     *
862     * @return The image (possibly {@code null}).
863     *
864     * @see #setBackgroundImage(Image)
865     */
866    public Image getBackgroundImage() {
867        return this.backgroundImage;
868    }
869
870    /**
871     * Sets the background image for the chart and sends a
872     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
873     *
874     * @param image  the image ({@code null} permitted).
875     *
876     * @see #getBackgroundImage()
877     */
878    public void setBackgroundImage(Image image) {
879        if (this.backgroundImage != null) {
880            if (!this.backgroundImage.equals(image)) {
881                this.backgroundImage = image;
882                fireChartChanged();
883            }
884        } else {
885            if (image != null) {
886                this.backgroundImage = image;
887                fireChartChanged();
888            }
889        }
890    }
891
892    /**
893     * Returns the background image alignment. 
894     *
895     * @return The alignment (never {@code null}).
896     *
897     * @see #setBackgroundImageAlignment(RectangleAlignment)
898     */
899    public RectangleAlignment getBackgroundImageAlignment() {
900        return this.backgroundImageAlignment;
901    }
902
903    /**
904     * Sets the background alignment and sends a change notification to all
905     * registered listeners.
906     *
907     * @param alignment  the alignment ({@code null} not permitted).
908     *
909     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlignment()
910     */
911    public void setBackgroundImageAlignment(RectangleAlignment alignment) {
912        Args.nullNotPermitted(alignment, "alignment");
913        if (this.backgroundImageAlignment != alignment) {
914            this.backgroundImageAlignment = alignment;
915            fireChartChanged();
916        }
917    }
918
919    /**
920     * Returns the alpha-transparency for the chart's background image.
921     *
922     * @return The alpha-transparency.
923     *
924     * @see #setBackgroundImageAlpha(float)
925     */
926    public float getBackgroundImageAlpha() {
927        return this.backgroundImageAlpha;
928    }
929
930    /**
931     * Sets the alpha-transparency for the chart's background image.
932     * Registered listeners are notified that the chart has been changed.
933     *
934     * @param alpha  the alpha value.
935     *
936     * @see #getBackgroundImageAlpha()
937     */
938    public void setBackgroundImageAlpha(float alpha) {
939        if (this.backgroundImageAlpha != alpha) {
940            this.backgroundImageAlpha = alpha;
941            fireChartChanged();
942        }
943    }
944
945    /**
946     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not change events are sent to
947     * registered listeners.
948     *
949     * @return A boolean.
950     *
951     * @see #setNotify(boolean)
952     */
953    public boolean isNotify() {
954        return this.notify;
955    }
956
957    /**
958     * Sets a flag that controls whether or not listeners receive
959     * {@link ChartChangeEvent} notifications.
960     *
961     * @param notify  a boolean.
962     *
963     * @see #isNotify()
964     */
965    public void setNotify(boolean notify) {
966        this.notify = notify;
967        // if the flag is being set to true, there may be queued up changes...
968        if (notify) {
969            notifyListeners(new ChartChangeEvent(this));
970        }
971    }
972
973    @Override
974    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
975        this.title.receive(visitor);
976        this.subtitles.forEach(subtitle -> {
977            subtitle.receive(visitor);
978        });
979        this.plot.receive(visitor);
980        visitor.visit(this);
981    }
982    
983    /**
984     * Draws the chart on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
985     * printer).
986     * <P>
987     * This method is the focus of the entire JFreeChart library.
988     *
989     * @param g2  the graphics device.
990     * @param area  the area within which the chart should be drawn.
991     */
992    @Override
993    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
994        draw(g2, area, null, null);
995    }
996
997    /**
998     * Draws the chart on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
999     * printer).  This method is the focus of the entire JFreeChart library.
1000     *
1001     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1002     * @param area  the area within which the chart should be drawn.
1003     * @param info  records info about the drawing (null means collect no info).
1004     */
1005    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1006        draw(g2, area, null, info);
1007    }
1008
1009    /**
1010     * Draws the chart on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
1011     * printer).
1012     * <P>
1013     * This method is the focus of the entire JFreeChart library.
1014     *
1015     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1016     * @param chartArea  the area within which the chart should be drawn.
1017     * @param anchor  the anchor point (in Java2D space) for the chart
1018     *                ({@code null} permitted).
1019     * @param info  records info about the drawing (null means collect no info).
1020     */
1021    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D chartArea, Point2D anchor,
1022             ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1023
1024        jFreeChartProduct2.notifyListeners(new ChartProgressEvent(this, this,
1025                ChartProgressEventType.DRAWING_STARTED, 0));
1026        
1027        if (this.elementHinting) {
1028            Map<String, String> m = new HashMap<>();
1029            if (this.id != null) {
1030                m.put("id", this.id);
1031            }
1032            m.put("ref", "JFREECHART_TOP_LEVEL");            
1033            g2.setRenderingHint(ChartHints.KEY_BEGIN_ELEMENT, m);            
1034        }
1035        
1036        EntityCollection entities = null;
1037        // record the chart area, if info is requested...
1038        if (info != null) {
1039            info.clear();
1040            info.setChartArea(chartArea);
1041            entities = info.getEntityCollection();
1042        }
1043        if (entities != null) {
1044            entities.add(new JFreeChartEntity((Rectangle2D) chartArea.clone(),
1045                    this));
1046        }
1047
1048        // ensure no drawing occurs outside chart area...
1049        Shape savedClip = g2.getClip();
1050        g2.clip(chartArea);
1051
1052        g2.addRenderingHints(this.renderingHints);
1053
1054        // draw the chart background...
1055        if (this.backgroundPaint != null) {
1056            g2.setPaint(this.backgroundPaint);
1057            g2.fill(chartArea);
1058        }
1059
1060        if (this.backgroundImage != null) {
1061            Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
1062            g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
1063                    this.backgroundImageAlpha));
1064            Rectangle2D dest = new Rectangle2D.Double(0.0, 0.0,
1065                    this.backgroundImage.getWidth(null),
1066                    this.backgroundImage.getHeight(null));
1067            this.backgroundImageAlignment.align(dest, chartArea);
1068            g2.drawImage(this.backgroundImage, (int) dest.getX(),
1069                    (int) dest.getY(), (int) dest.getWidth(),
1070                    (int) dest.getHeight(), null);
1071            g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
1072        }
1073
1074        if (isBorderVisible()) {
1075            Paint paint = getBorderPaint();
1076            Stroke stroke = getBorderStroke();
1077            if (paint != null && stroke != null) {
1078                Rectangle2D borderArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(
1079                        chartArea.getX(), chartArea.getY(),
1080                        chartArea.getWidth() - 1.0, chartArea.getHeight()
1081                        - 1.0);
1082                g2.setPaint(paint);
1083                g2.setStroke(stroke);
1084                g2.draw(borderArea);
1085            }
1086        }
1087
1088        // draw the title and subtitles...
1089        Rectangle2D nonTitleArea = new Rectangle2D.Double();
1090        nonTitleArea.setRect(chartArea);
1091        this.padding.trim(nonTitleArea);
1092
1093        if (this.title != null && this.title.isVisible()) {
1094            EntityCollection e = drawTitle(this.title, g2, nonTitleArea,
1095                    (entities != null));
1096            if (e != null && entities != null) {
1097                entities.addAll(e);
1098            }
1099        }
1100
1101        for (Title currentTitle : this.subtitles) {
1102            if (currentTitle.isVisible()) {
1103                EntityCollection e = drawTitle(currentTitle, g2, nonTitleArea,
1104                        (entities != null));
1105                if (e != null && entities != null) {
1106                    entities.addAll(e);
1107                }
1108            }
1109        }
1110
1111        Rectangle2D plotArea = nonTitleArea;
1112
1113        // draw the plot (axes and data visualisation)
1114        PlotRenderingInfo plotInfo = null;
1115        if (info != null) {
1116            plotInfo = info.getPlotInfo();
1117        }
1118        this.plot.draw(g2, plotArea, anchor, null, plotInfo);
1119        g2.setClip(savedClip);
1120        if (this.elementHinting) {         
1121            g2.setRenderingHint(ChartHints.KEY_END_ELEMENT, Boolean.TRUE);            
1122        }
1123
1124        jFreeChartProduct2.notifyListeners(new ChartProgressEvent(this, this,
1125                ChartProgressEventType.DRAWING_FINISHED, 100));
1126    }
1127
1128    /**
1129     * Draws a title.  The title should be drawn at the top, bottom, left or
1130     * right of the specified area, and the area should be updated to reflect
1131     * the amount of space used by the title.
1132     *
1133     * @param t  the title ({@code null} not permitted).
1134     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
1135     * @param area  the chart area, excluding any existing titles
1136     *              ({@code null} not permitted).
1137     * @param entities  a flag that controls whether or not an entity
1138     *                  collection is returned for the title.
1139     *
1140     * @return An entity collection for the title (possibly {@code null}).
1141     */
1142    protected EntityCollection drawTitle(Title t, Graphics2D g2,
1143                                         Rectangle2D area, boolean entities) {
1144
1145        Args.nullNotPermitted(t, "t");
1146        Args.nullNotPermitted(area, "area");
1147        Rectangle2D titleArea;
1148        RectangleEdge position = t.getPosition();
1149        double ww = area.getWidth();
1150        if (ww <= 0.0) {
1151            return null;
1152        }
1153        double hh = area.getHeight();
1154        if (hh <= 0.0) {
1155            return null;
1156        }
1157        RectangleConstraint constraint = new RectangleConstraint(ww,
1158                new Range(0.0, ww), LengthConstraintType.RANGE, hh,
1159                new Range(0.0, hh), LengthConstraintType.RANGE);
1160        Object retValue = null;
1161        BlockParams p = new BlockParams();
1162        p.setGenerateEntities(entities);
1163        switch (position) {
1164            case TOP: {
1165                Size2D size = t.arrange(g2, constraint);
1166                titleArea = size.createAlignedRectangle2D(area,
1167                        t.getHorizontalAlignment(), VerticalAlignment.TOP);
1168                retValue = t.draw(g2, titleArea, p);
1169                area.setRect(area.getX(), Math.min(area.getY() + size.height,
1170                        area.getMaxY()), area.getWidth(), Math.max(area.getHeight()
1171                        - size.height, 0));
1172                break;
1173            }
1174            case BOTTOM: {
1175                Size2D size = t.arrange(g2, constraint);
1176                titleArea = size.createAlignedRectangle2D(area,
1177                        t.getHorizontalAlignment(), VerticalAlignment.BOTTOM);
1178                retValue = t.draw(g2, titleArea, p);
1179                area.setRect(area.getX(), area.getY(), area.getWidth(),
1180                        area.getHeight() - size.height);
1181                break;
1182            }
1183            case RIGHT: {
1184                Size2D size = t.arrange(g2, constraint);
1185                titleArea = size.createAlignedRectangle2D(area,
1186                        HorizontalAlignment.RIGHT, t.getVerticalAlignment());
1187                retValue = t.draw(g2, titleArea, p);
1188                area.setRect(area.getX(), area.getY(), area.getWidth()
1189                        - size.width, area.getHeight());
1190                break;
1191            }
1192            case LEFT: {
1193                Size2D size = t.arrange(g2, constraint);
1194                titleArea = size.createAlignedRectangle2D(area,
1195                        HorizontalAlignment.LEFT, t.getVerticalAlignment());
1196                retValue = t.draw(g2, titleArea, p);
1197                area.setRect(area.getX() + size.width, area.getY(), area.getWidth()
1198                        - size.width, area.getHeight());
1199                break;
1200            }
1201            default: {
1202                throw new RuntimeException("Unrecognised title position.");
1203            }
1204        }
1205        EntityCollection result = null;
1206        if (retValue instanceof EntityBlockResult) {
1207            EntityBlockResult ebr = (EntityBlockResult) retValue;
1208            result = ebr.getEntityCollection();
1209        }
1210        return result;
1211    }
1212
1213    /**
1214     * Creates and returns a buffered image into which the chart has been drawn.
1215     *
1216     * @param width  the width.
1217     * @param height  the height.
1218     *
1219     * @return A buffered image.
1220     */
1221    public BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int width, int height) {
1222        return createBufferedImage(width, height, null);
1223    }
1224
1225    /**
1226     * Creates and returns a buffered image into which the chart has been drawn.
1227     *
1228     * @param width  the width.
1229     * @param height  the height.
1230     * @param info  carries back chart state information ({@code null}
1231     *              permitted).
1232     *
1233     * @return A buffered image.
1234     */
1235    public BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int width, int height,
1236                                             ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1237        return createBufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB,
1238                info);
1239    }
1240
1241    /**
1242     * Creates and returns a buffered image into which the chart has been drawn.
1243     *
1244     * @param width  the width.
1245     * @param height  the height.
1246     * @param imageType  the image type.
1247     * @param info  carries back chart state information ({@code null}
1248     *              permitted).
1249     *
1250     * @return A buffered image.
1251     */
1252    public BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int width, int height,
1253            int imageType, ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1254        BufferedImage image = new BufferedImage(width, height, imageType);
1255        Graphics2D g2 = image.createGraphics();
1256        draw(g2, new Rectangle2D.Double(0, 0, width, height), null, info);
1257        g2.dispose();
1258        return image;
1259    }
1260
1261    /**
1262     * Creates and returns a buffered image into which the chart has been drawn.
1263     *
1264     * @param imageWidth  the image width.
1265     * @param imageHeight  the image height.
1266     * @param drawWidth  the width for drawing the chart (will be scaled to
1267     *                   fit image).
1268     * @param drawHeight  the height for drawing the chart (will be scaled to
1269     *                    fit image).
1270     * @param info  optional object for collection chart dimension and entity
1271     *              information.
1272     *
1273     * @return A buffered image.
1274     */
1275    public BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int imageWidth,
1276                                             int imageHeight,
1277                                             double drawWidth,
1278                                             double drawHeight,
1279                                             ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1280
1281        BufferedImage image = new BufferedImage(imageWidth, imageHeight,
1282                BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB);
1283        Graphics2D g2 = image.createGraphics();
1284        double scaleX = imageWidth / drawWidth;
1285        double scaleY = imageHeight / drawHeight;
1286        AffineTransform st = AffineTransform.getScaleInstance(scaleX, scaleY);
1287        g2.transform(st);
1288        draw(g2, new Rectangle2D.Double(0, 0, drawWidth, drawHeight), null,
1289                info);
1290        g2.dispose();
1291        return image;
1292    }
1293
1294    /**
1295     * Handles a 'click' on the chart.  JFreeChart is not a UI component, so
1296     * some other object (for example, {@link ChartPanel}) needs to capture
1297     * the click event and pass it onto the JFreeChart object.
1298     * If you are not using JFreeChart in a client application, then this
1299     * method is not required.
1300     *
1301     * @param x  x-coordinate of the click (in Java2D space).
1302     * @param y  y-coordinate of the click (in Java2D space).
1303     * @param info  contains chart dimension and entity information
1304     *              ({@code null} not permitted).
1305     */
1306    public void handleClick(int x, int y, ChartRenderingInfo info) {
1307        // pass the click on to the plot...
1308        // rely on the plot to post a plot change event and redraw the chart...
1309        this.plot.handleClick(x, y, info.getPlotInfo());
1310    }
1311
1312    /**
1313     * Registers an object for notification of changes to the chart.
1314     *
1315     * @param listener  the listener ({@code null} not permitted).
1316     *
1317     * @see #removeChangeListener(ChartChangeListener)
1318     */
1319    public void addChangeListener(ChartChangeListener listener) {
1320        jFreeChartProduct.addChangeListener(listener);
1321    }
1322
1323    /**
1324     * Deregisters an object for notification of changes to the chart.
1325     *
1326     * @param listener  the listener ({@code null} not permitted)
1327     *
1328     * @see #addChangeListener(ChartChangeListener)
1329     */
1330    public void removeChangeListener(ChartChangeListener listener) {
1331        jFreeChartProduct.removeChangeListener(listener);
1332    }
1333
1334    /**
1335     * Sends a default {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1336     * <P>
1337     * This method is for convenience only.
1338     */
1339    public void fireChartChanged() {
1340        ChartChangeEvent event = new ChartChangeEvent(this);
1341        notifyListeners(event);
1342    }
1343
1344    /**
1345     * Sends a {@link ChartChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1346     *
1347     * @param event  information about the event that triggered the
1348     *               notification.
1349     */
1350    protected void notifyListeners(ChartChangeEvent event) {
1351        if (this.notify) {
1352            Object[] listeners = this.jFreeChartProduct.getChangeListeners().getListenerList();
1353            for (int i = listeners.length - 2; i >= 0; i -= 2) {
1354                if (listeners[i] == ChartChangeListener.class) {
1355                    ((ChartChangeListener) listeners[i + 1]).chartChanged(
1356                            event);
1357                }
1358            }
1359        }
1360    }
1361
1362    /**
1363     * Registers an object for notification of progress events relating to the
1364     * chart.
1365     *
1366     * @param listener  the object being registered.
1367     *
1368     * @see #removeProgressListener(ChartProgressListener)
1369     */
1370    public void addProgressListener(ChartProgressListener listener) {
1371        jFreeChartProduct2.addProgressListener(listener);
1372    }
1373
1374    /**
1375     * Deregisters an object for notification of changes to the chart.
1376     *
1377     * @param listener  the object being deregistered.
1378     *
1379     * @see #addProgressListener(ChartProgressListener)
1380     */
1381    public void removeProgressListener(ChartProgressListener listener) {
1382        jFreeChartProduct2.removeProgressListener(listener);
1383    }
1384
1385    /**
1386     * Sends a {@link ChartProgressEvent} to all registered listeners.
1387     *
1388     * @param event  information about the event that triggered the
1389     *               notification.
1390     */
1391    protected void notifyListeners(ChartProgressEvent event) {
1392        jFreeChartProduct2.notifyListeners(event);
1393    }
1394
1395    /**
1396     * Receives notification that a chart title has changed, and passes this
1397     * on to registered listeners.
1398     *
1399     * @param event  information about the chart title change.
1400     */
1401    @Override
1402    public void titleChanged(TitleChangeEvent event) {
1403        event.setChart(this);
1404        notifyListeners(event);
1405    }
1406
1407    /**
1408     * Receives notification that the plot has changed, and passes this on to
1409     * registered listeners.
1410     *
1411     * @param event  information about the plot change.
1412     */
1413    @Override
1414    public void plotChanged(PlotChangeEvent event) {
1415        event.setChart(this);
1416        notifyListeners(event);
1417    }
1418
1419    /**
1420     * Tests this chart for equality with another object.
1421     *
1422     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1423     *
1424     * @return A boolean.
1425     */
1426    @Override
1427    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1428        if (obj == this) {
1429            return true;
1430        }
1431        if (!(obj instanceof JFreeChart)) {
1432            return false;
1433        }
1434        JFreeChart that = (JFreeChart) obj;
1435        if (!this.renderingHints.equals(that.renderingHints)) {
1436            return false;
1437        }
1438        if (this.borderVisible != that.borderVisible) {
1439            return false;
1440        }
1441        if (!Objects.equals(this.borderStroke, that.borderStroke)) {
1442            return false;
1443        }
1444        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.borderPaint, that.borderPaint)) {
1445            return false;
1446        }
1447        if (!this.padding.equals(that.padding)) {
1448            return false;
1449        }
1450        if (!Objects.equals(this.title, that.title)) {
1451            return false;
1452        }
1453        if (!Objects.equals(this.subtitles, that.subtitles)) {
1454            return false;
1455        }
1456        if (!Objects.equals(this.plot, that.plot)) {
1457            return false;
1458        }
1459        if (!PaintUtils.equal(
1460            this.backgroundPaint, that.backgroundPaint
1461        )) {
1462            return false;
1463        }
1464        if (!Objects.equals(this.backgroundImage, that.backgroundImage)) {
1465            return false;
1466        }
1467        if (this.backgroundImageAlignment != that.backgroundImageAlignment) {
1468            return false;
1469        }
1470        if (this.backgroundImageAlpha != that.backgroundImageAlpha) {
1471            return false;
1472        }
1473        if (this.notify != that.notify) {
1474            return false;
1475        }
1476        return true;
1477    }
1478
1479    @Override
1480    public int hashCode() {
1481        int hash = 7;
1482        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.renderingHints);
1483        hash = 59 * hash + (this.borderVisible ? 1 : 0);
1484        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.borderStroke);
1485        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.borderPaint);
1486        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.padding);
1487        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.title);
1488        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.subtitles);
1489        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.plot);
1490        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.backgroundPaint);
1491        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.backgroundImage);
1492        hash = 59 * hash + Objects.hashCode(this.backgroundImageAlignment);
1493        hash = 59 * hash + Float.floatToIntBits(this.backgroundImageAlpha);
1494        hash = 59 * hash + (this.notify ? 1 : 0);
1495        return hash;
1496    }
1497
1498    /**
1499     * Provides serialization support.
1500     *
1501     * @param stream  the output stream.
1502     *
1503     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1504     */
1505    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1506        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1507                stream.writeObject(this.jFreeChartProduct2);
1508                stream.writeObject(this.jFreeChartProduct);
1509        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.borderStroke, stream);
1510        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.borderPaint, stream);
1511        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.backgroundPaint, stream);
1512    }
1513
1514    /**
1515     * Provides serialization support.
1516     *
1517     * @param stream  the input stream.
1518     *
1519     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1520     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1521     */
1522    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1523        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1524        stream.defaultReadObject();
1525                this.jFreeChartProduct2 = (JFreeChartProduct2) stream.readObject();
1526                this.jFreeChartProduct = (JFreeChartProduct) stream.readObject();
1527        this.borderStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1528        this.borderPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1529        this.backgroundPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1530        jFreeChartProduct2.setProgressListeners(new EventListenerList());
1531        jFreeChartProduct.setChangeListeners(new EventListenerList());
1532        this.renderingHints = new RenderingHints(
1533                RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING,
1534                RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
1535        this.renderingHints.put(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL,
1536                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_PURE);
1537        
1538        // register as a listener with sub-components...
1539        if (this.title != null) {
1540            this.title.addChangeListener(this);
1541        }
1542
1543        for (int i = 0; i < getSubtitleCount(); i++) {
1544            getSubtitle(i).addChangeListener(this);
1545        }
1546        this.plot.addChangeListener(this);
1547    }
1548
1549    /**
1550     * Clones the object, and takes care of listeners.
1551     * Note: caller shall register its own listeners on cloned graph.
1552     *
1553     * @return A clone.
1554     *
1555     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if the chart is not cloneable.
1556     */
1557    @Override
1558    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1559        JFreeChart chart = (JFreeChart) super.clone();
1560                chart.jFreeChartProduct2 = (JFreeChartProduct2) this.jFreeChartProduct2.clone();
1561                chart.jFreeChartProduct = (JFreeChartProduct) this.jFreeChartProduct.clone();
1562
1563        chart.renderingHints = (RenderingHints) this.renderingHints.clone();
1564        // private boolean borderVisible;
1565        // private transient Stroke borderStroke;
1566        // private transient Paint borderPaint;
1567
1568        if (this.title != null) {
1569            chart.title = (TextTitle) this.title.clone();
1570            chart.title.addChangeListener(chart);
1571        }
1572
1573        chart.subtitles = new ArrayList<>();
1574        for (int i = 0; i < getSubtitleCount(); i++) {
1575            Title subtitle = (Title) getSubtitle(i).clone();
1576            chart.subtitles.add(subtitle);
1577            subtitle.addChangeListener(chart);
1578        }
1579
1580        if (this.plot != null) {
1581            chart.plot = (Plot) this.plot.clone();
1582            chart.plot.addChangeListener(chart);
1583        }
1584
1585        chart.jFreeChartProduct2.setProgressListeners(new EventListenerList());
1586        chart.jFreeChartProduct.setChangeListeners(new EventListenerList());
1587        return chart;
1588    }
1589
1590        /**
1591         * A utility method that creates an image of a chart, with scaling.
1592         * @param w   the image width.
1593         * @param h   the image height.
1594         * @param minDrawW   the minimum width for chart drawing.
1595         * @param minDrawH   the minimum height for chart drawing.
1596         * @param maxDrawW   the maximum width for chart drawing.
1597         * @param maxDrawH   the maximum height for chart drawing.
1598         * @return   A chart image.
1599         */
1600        public BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int w, int h, int minDrawW, int minDrawH, int maxDrawW, int maxDrawH) {
1601                BufferedImage image = new BufferedImage(w, h, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB);
1602                Graphics2D g2 = image.createGraphics();
1603                boolean scale = false;
1604                double drawWidth = w;
1605                double drawHeight = h;
1606                double scaleX = 1.0;
1607                double scaleY = 1.0;
1608                if (drawWidth < minDrawW) {
1609                        scaleX = drawWidth / minDrawW;
1610                        drawWidth = minDrawW;
1611                        scale = true;
1612                } else if (drawWidth > maxDrawW) {
1613                        scaleX = drawWidth / maxDrawW;
1614                        drawWidth = maxDrawW;
1615                        scale = true;
1616                }
1617                if (drawHeight < minDrawH) {
1618                        scaleY = drawHeight / minDrawH;
1619                        drawHeight = minDrawH;
1620                        scale = true;
1621                } else if (drawHeight > maxDrawH) {
1622                        scaleY = drawHeight / maxDrawH;
1623                        drawHeight = maxDrawH;
1624                        scale = true;
1625                }
1626                Rectangle2D chartArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(0.0, 0.0, drawWidth, drawHeight);
1627                if (scale) {
1628                        AffineTransform st = AffineTransform.getScaleInstance(scaleX, scaleY);
1629                        g2.transform(st);
1630                }
1631                draw(g2, chartArea, null, null);
1632                g2.dispose();
1633                return image;
1634        }
1635
1636
1637}
